page.title: 07Penn/Tylers Green Study
page.content: When we went to{Penn}the first thing we noticed was that we were on a hillside looking over the valley. It was a lovely view. We saw trees climbing the other hillside.{Penn}is in{Buckinghamshire}600ft above sea level with an area of 4,182 acres. {Penn}is in the middle of a triangle really because there is{High Wycombe in the West,{Amersham}to the North East and{Beaconsfield} to the South East. Most houses in{Penn}are over 100 years old and some are 300 years old. Houses cost between Â£100,000 and Â£300,000. We noticed a Methodist chapel built in 1808 and Holy Trinity church built in 1077. The Crown Inn is over 3oo year old,.It is made of brick and has a clay roof. We can tell it is very old because its chimney is out side. It has a vast amount of ivy on it.
